api_errors.description: Definition of standard errors returned by MetaCPAN API

code.description: A 3 digits code representing the error.

message.description: The error message designed for human consumption with more details about the error.

param.description: If the error is parameter-specific, the parameter related to the error.

api_errors.title: APIErrors

author_mapping.description: This is the object representing the availble fields for the [author object](https://explorer.metacpan.org/?url=/author/_mapping).
author_mapping.title: AuthorMapping

changes.description: This is the object representing a MetaCPAN [module changes file](https://github.com/metacpan/metacpan-api/blob/master/docs/API-docs.md#get-searches)
changes.title: Changes

contributor.description: This is the object representing contributors
contributor.title: Contributor

contributor_mapping.description: This is the object representing the availble fields for the [contributor object](https://explorer.metacpan.org/?url=/contributor/_mapping).
contributor_mapping.title: ContributorMapping

cover.description: This is the object representing a MetaCPAN [module coverage](http://cpancover.com/)
cover.title: Cover

diff.description: This is the object representing difference in multiple files between 2 releases
This property is only available when comparing 2 file IDs

diff.title: Diff

distribution.description: This is the object representing a MetaCPAN [author distribution](https://github.com/metacpan/metacpan-api/blob/master/docs/API-docs.md#distributiondistribution)
distribution.title: Distribution

distribution_mapping.description: This is the object representing the availble fields for the [distribution object](https://explorer.metacpan.org/?url=/distribution/_mapping).
distribution_mapping.title: DistributionMapping

distributions.description: This is the object representing a list of distributions.
This contains dynamic properties named after the perl distribution name, such as "HTTP-Message"

distributions.title: Distributions

download_url.description: This is the object representing a MetaCPAN [distribution download URL](https://github.com/metacpan/metacpan-api/blob/master/docs/API-docs.md#download_urlmodule)
download_url.title: DownloadURL

elastic_search.description: An Elasticsearch search request with a subset of options.

size.description: The maximum number of search results to return.

sort.description: An array of fields to sort the search results by.

elastic_search.title: Search

error.description: An error response from the MetaCPAN API
error.title: Error

es_bool_query.description: A query for documents that match boolean combinations of other queries.

minimum_should_match.description: The minimum number of optional should clauses to match.

es_exists_query.description: Matches documents that have at least one non-`null` value in the original field.

field.description: The field to check for non-null values in.

es_match_all_query.description: A query that matches all documents.

es_match_none_query.description: A query that doesn't match any documents.

es_match_query.description: Consumes and analyzes text, numbers, and dates, then constructs a query.

analyzer.description: The analyzer that will be used to perform the analysis process on the text. Defaults to the analyzer that was used to index the field.

minimum_should_match.description: The minimum number of optional should clauses to match.

operator.description: The operator flag can be set to or or and to control the boolean clauses (defaults to or).

es_nested_query.description: A query that matches nested objects.

path.description: The path to the nested object.

query.description: The actual query to execute on the nested objects.

score_mode.description: Allows to specify how inner children matching affects score of the parent. Refer to the Elasticsearch documentation for details.

es_prefix_query.description: The query that matches documents with fields that contain terms with a specified, not analyzed, prefix.

boost.description: An optional boost value to apply to the query.

es_query_container.description: The container for all of the allowed Elasticsearch queries. Specify only one property each time.

es_query_string_query.description: A query that uses the strict query string syntax for parsing. Will return an error for invalid syntax.

allow_leading_wildcard.description: When set, * or ? are allowed as the first character. Defaults to false.

analyzer.description: The analyzer used to analyze each term of the query when creating composite queries.

default_field.description: The default field for query terms if no prefix field is specified.

default_operator.description: The default operator used if no explicit operator is specified.

query.description: The actual query to be parsed.

es_range_query.description: The query that matches documents with fields that contain terms within a specified range.

boost.description: An optional boost value to apply to the query.

format.description: Formatted dates will be parsed using the format specified on the date field by default, but it can be overridden by passing the format parameter.

time_zone.description: Dates can be converted from another timezone to UTC either by specifying the time zone in the date value itself (if the format accepts it), or it can be specified as the time_zone parameter.

es_simple_query_string_query.description: A query that uses simple query string syntax. Will ignore invalid syntax.

analyze_wildcard.description: If `true`, the query attempts to analyze wildcard terms. Defaults to `false`.

analyzer.description: The name of the analyzer to use to convert the query text into tokens.

auto_generate_synonyms_phrase_query.description: If `true`, the parse creates a `match_phrase` uery for each multi-position token. Defaults to `true`.

default_operator.description: The boolean operator used to combine the terms of the query. Valid values are `OR` (default) and `AND`.

flags.description: List of enabled operators for the simple query string syntax. Defaults to `ALL`.

fuzzy_max_expansions.description: Maximum number of terms to which the query expands for fuzzy matching. Defaults to 50.

fuzzy_prefix_length.description: Number of beginning characters left unchanged for fuzzy matching. Defaults to 0.

fuzzy_transpositions.description: If `true`, edits for fuzzy matching include transpositions of two adjacent characters. Defaults to `false`.

lenient.description: If `true`, format-based errors, such as providing a text value for a numeric field are ignored. Defaults to `false`.

minimum_should_match.description: Minimum number of clauses that must match for a document to be returned.

query.description: The query expressed in simple query string syntax.

quote_field_suffix.description: Suffix appended to quoted text in the query string.

es_term_query.description: A query for documents that contain the specified term in the inverted index.

value.description: The exact value to query for.

info.description: The MetaCPAN REST API. Please see https://github.com/metacpan/metacpan-api/blob/master/docs/API-docs.md for more details.
info.title: MetaCPAN API

get.description: Retrieves the release activity for the last 24 months

parameters.description: An optional author ID
parameters.name: author

parameters.description: An optional distribution name
parameters.name: distribution

parameters.description: An optional module used as a dependency.
parameters.name: module

parameters.description: To show only new distributions
parameters.name: new_dists

parameters.description: The aggregation interval. See [ElasticSearch documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/2.4/query-dsl-range-query.html#_date_format_in_range_queries)
parameters.name: res

parameters.name: res

get.description:
Retrieves a download URL for a given module.
The `/download_url` endpoint exists specifically for the `cpanm` client. It takes a module name with an optional version (or range of versions) and an optional `dev` flag (for development releases) and returns a `download_url` as well as some other helpful info.

Obviously anyone can use this endpoint, but we'll only consider changes to this endpoint after considering how `cpanm` might be affected.

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be provided.
parameters.name: fields

post.description:
Retrieves a download URL for a given module.
The `/download_url` endpoint exists specifically for the `cpanm` client. It takes a module name with an optional version (or range of versions) and an optional `dev` flag (for development releases) and returns a `download_url` as well as some other helpful info.

Obviously anyone can use this endpoint, but we'll only consider changes to this endpoint after considering how `cpanm` might be affected.

get.description:
Returns the POD of the given module in the specified release. You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown

parameters.description:
You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown
parameters.name: content-type

post.description:
Returns the POD of the given module in the specified release. Valid content types are:

* text/plain
* text/x-pod

get.description:
Returns the POD of the given module. You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/HTTP::Message?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown

parameters.description:
You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown
parameters.name: content-type

post.description:
Returns the POD of the given module. You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/HTTP::Message?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown. POST method is possible, but still with a query string. JSON payload are not recognised.

parameters.description:
You can change the output format by either passing a `content-type` query parameter (e.g. [/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/pod/HTTP-Message?content-type=text/plain) or by adding an `Accept` header to the HTTP request. Valid content types are:

* text/html (default)
* text/plain
* text/x-pod
* text/x-markdown
parameters.name: content-type

get.description: Takes some POD data and check for errors. It returns the POD provided in formatted plan text.

parameters.description: The POD data to format
parameters.name: pod

schema.example:
Hello World
    Something here

POD ERRORS
    Hey! The above document had some coding errors, which are explained below:

    Around line 7:
        Unknown directive: =oops

post.description: Takes some POD data and check for errors. It returns the POD provided in formatted plan text.

get.description:
Retrieves a distribution release information details.
This `/release` endpoint accepts  the name of an `author` and the name of the `release` (e.g. [/release/DOY/OALDERS/HTTP-Message-6.37](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/release/DOY/OALDERS/HTTP-Message-6.37)), which returns the most recent release of the distribution.

parameters.description: Specifies which object to [join](https://github.com/metacpan/metacpan-api/blob/master/docs/API-docs.md#joins) in the result.
parameters.name: join

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be provided.
parameters.name: fields

post.description:
Retrieves a distribution release information details.
This `/release` endpoint accepts  the name of an `author` and the name of the `release` (e.g. [/release/DOY/OALDERS/HTTP-Message-6.37](https://fastapi.metacpan.org/v1/release/DOY/OALDERS/HTTP-Message-6.37)), which returns the most recent release of the distribution.

get.description: Perform API search in the same fashion as the Web UI

parameters.description:
The query search term. If the search term contains a term with the tags `dist:` or `module:` results will be in expanded form, otherwise collapsed form.

See also `collapsed`
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: The offset to use in the result set
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Force a collapsed even when searching for a particular distribution or module name.
parameters.name: collapsed

parameters.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be provided.
parameters.name: fields
